title: Conor McGregor eyes up Nate Diaz trilogy as he says former foe and Jorge Masvidal are 'on my radar'
text:
Conor McGregor is eyeing up a fight against the winner of next month's blockbuster showdown between Jorge Masvidal and Nate Diaz.

Speculation about who McGregor will face in his UFC comeback has been rife with the Irishman set to clarify his future at a press conference in Moscow on Thursday.

'The Notorious', who has not fought since being choked out by Russian Khabib Nurmagomedov last October, has hinted at a number of possible opponents, most recently Frankie Edgar.

Conor McGregor has admitted he is keen to fight the winner of Jorge Masvidal vs Nate Diaz

Masvidal (L) and Diaz (R) face off in a huge showdown next month at Madison Square Garden

However, now McGregor has indicated that a trilogy fight with Nate Diaz could be on the cards, providing he beats Masvidal in their 'Baddest Motherf***er' bout at the fabled Madison Square Garden next month.

'I designed that 'Bad Motherf***er' belt,' McGregor said as reported by MMA Junkie. 'I actually designed that. I signed off on the design of how they are creating that belt.

'So most certainly that belt was brought into fruition, brought to life because of me: the real bad motherf***er. So most certainly one of those men is on my radar.'

McGregor is expected to make his long-awaited return to the octagon at the end of the year, though nothing has been confirmed yet.

McGregor won his rematch against Diaz, having surprisingly lost their first encounter

Dana White insisted he has no plans of making a fight between McGregor and Frankie Edgar

However, UFC president Dana White has admitted that McGregor will not be facing Edgar despite the Irishman recently suggesting a deal had been struck.

White said recently: 'Conor loves to fight and wants to fight again, but that Frankie Edgar fight isn't going to happen.

'Edgar is two weight classes below him. Edgar is in a position; he was supposed to fight Aljamain Sterling, and Aljamain fell out, got hurt.

'Frankie's coming to the end of his career and he could end up getting himself into a title position again. So to take the Conor fight makes no sense.'
description: Conor McGregor has admitted he is keen to fight the winner of next month's blockbuster showdown between Nate Diaz and Jorge Masvidal ahead of his expected return to UFC later this year.
